meanings.definition: Mises (verb): third person singular present of mise
meanings.sent1: She mises the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: He always mises the target when he throws.
meanings.sent3: The cat mises the yarn all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The chef expertly mises the ingredients together.
meanings.sent5: The student mises the answer and gets it right.

meanings.sent1: They placed their mises on the roulette table.
meanings.sent2: The mises on the table were carefully counted.
meanings.sent3: The mises in the jar jingled as she moved it.
meanings.sent4: The colorful mises added a festive touch to the room.
meanings.sent5: The mises in the collection were all unique and valuable.
